comment: Overall, I thought he did a great job at teaching. Class comprised of 4 tests (non-cumulative, including the final). We often got out early, however, he required us to do online homework weekly. He also takes attendance, has a no electronics policy, and does not post main power points. Overall, he is a decent choice if you must take communications.

Makes the classes as best he can, makes jokes all the time and has anecdotes about the subjects. We rarely stayed the full time. No curve, but he's willing to bump your grade depending on your participation.

As a part time prof, he uses his experience in advertising and his marriage history to teach concepts on a real life scenarios. The tests are straight forward with information directly from lectures and readings. He makes it so interesting that after taking this course, I changed my major to comm. Hes funny and passionate and respectable

The class stinks, largely because it's so laced with leftist propaganda, but, if you have to take it, take Prof. McDonald. His lectures are engaging and humorous, and the class is easy if you read scrupulously. He is VERY particular about the homework, which he grades VERY strictly, so take careful notes. The final is not cumulative.

Mr. Mcdonald is a great teacher with the intent of telling you how to get a job. He is tough at the beginning and does not take any BS when it come to anything, but thats to instill the discipline college students need. overall he is a great teacher
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Overall, a good experience. He assigns you in groups at the beginning of the semester that you're stuck with and you have these group assignments throughout the semester that are for extra credit, and pretty fun. Tests were difficult though and he has random hw assignments, but the usual, if you study and pay attention, you'll do fine.

Mr. McDonald is a great guy. He seems pretty tough at the beginning, but if you respect him and his class, he is a nice guy. Dont let your phone distract you and do your work and you will be fine with him.

Great Public Speaking professor, Test are easy and straight from the "blue page summaries" in the book. He lets you go early on lecture days, and works with you with speeches. Overall great choice if you want a goofy old dude that doesnt give a crap.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Would take again

comment: A bitter old man who loves to talk about how his bad communication lead to divorces and how he is going to hell for helping with the invention of the cell phone. He doesn't help you in studying for tests, has random homework assignments which he is super picky about in grading, and I would suggest picking another teacher.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: As long as you pay attention and take notes you'll be just fine. He take 2 points off your final grade when you miss, but if you talk to him beforehand he sometimes makes exceptions. He also assigns lots of group projects but a lot of them offer extra credit. Probably one of the funniest professors I've ever had.

McDonald is a good prof, kinda strict though. You have to work in groups the whole semester. 4 exams and 1 cumulative final exam aren't bad, you can find them all on quizlet. Only con is that he takes 2 points off your final grade for every day of class you miss. Overall very clear-cut syllabus and grading scale. Do the work and you'll pass easily.
For a communication teacher, he was a very bad communicator. He takes 2 points off your attendance grade for every class you miss. Very harsh. Would not recommend taking him.
Easy A.  Don't even have to go to class.  Easiest teacher that teaches this class.  tbake him for sure.
Not much homework.  Class seems easy as material is quite simple.  However, it is not an easy A.  Tests are an easy B, but you have to study for the A.

Great professor he's honest and speaks in a way you can understand. We're supposed to read the book but I never did and still got an A. The class is very easy there are no papers and very few homework assignments. He does make you work in groups the whole semester though, but it usually works out well. Great class lots of fun attendance no mandator

I love Mr. McDonald! His lectures are clear and interesting, and he adds extra knowledge with his advertising experience and relationship advice. Very funny! If you attend class every day, do the assignments and study for the test this class should be fairly easy. I wish I could take him for more classes.
Although he talks A LOT! he's a pretty good teacher.class was easy I made a C on every test just by listening to lecture no studying!
